snippet: The increase in truck sales fed double-digit sales growth for Detroit and kept the industry on track to sell more than 15 million vehicles this year.
abstract: American automakers report sales of pickup trucks rose sharply in April due in part to revival in housing market and increased demand from oil and gas industry; industry sold 1.28 million vehicles during that month, 8.5 percent improvement over a year earlier; boom in truck sales keeps industry on track to sell more than 15 million vehicles in 2013.
lead_paragraph: The increase in truck sales fed double-digit sales growth for Detroit and kept the industry on track to sell more than 15 million vehicles this year.

headline.seo: Trucks Help Detroit Carmakers Post a Strong April
headline.main: Truck Sales Led a Strong April for U.S. Automakers
headline.print_headline: Truck Sales Led a Strong April for U.S. Automakers
